subject: Science
title: The Mariana Trench
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Mariana Trench.

hook.text: If you dropped Mount Everest into the Mariana Trench, its peak would still be 2 km underwater.

buildup.text: The trench formed where the Pacific Plate dives under the Mariana Plate.

discovery.text: In 1960, Jacques Piccard and Don Walsh descended 10,916 m in the bathyscaphe Trieste.

twist.text: They saw a flatfish at the bottom â€” proof that life exists even at maximum depth.

climax.text: In 2019, Victor Vescovo dove to 10,928 m â€” and found a plastic bag there.

punchline.text: Humans have visited the deepest point on Earth. So has our plastic.

quiz.question: What did Victor Vescovo find at the bottom of the Mariana Trench in 2019?
